<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN LOGICAL PAGE -->

<DIV style="margin-top: 18pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">US&#160;Airways
    Group, Inc.<BR>
    </FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Notes to
    Consolidated Financial
    Statements&#160;&#151;&#160;(Continued)</FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>
<P>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

<TR>
    <TD width="6%"></TD>
    <TD width="94%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">&#160;&#160;(e)&#160;&#160;</FONT></I></B>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Guarantees
    and Indemnifications</FONT></I></B>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The Company guarantees the payment of principal and interest on
    certain special facility revenue bonds issued by municipalities
    to build or improve certain airport and maintenance facilities
    which are leased to US&#160;Airways and AWA. Under such leases,
    US&#160;Airways and AWA are required to make rental payments
    sufficient to pay maturing principal and interest payments on
    the related bonds. As of December&#160;31, 2006, the principal
    amount outstanding of these bonds was $96&#160;million.
    Remaining lease payments guaranteeing the principal and interest
    on these bonds will be $163&#160;million.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The Company enters into real estate leases in substantially all
    cities that it serves. It is common in such commercial lease
    transactions for the Company as the lessee to agree to indemnify
    the lessor and other related third parties for tort liabilities
    that arise out of or relate to the use or occupancy of the
    leased premises. In some cases, this indemnity extends to
    related liabilities arising from the negligence of the
    indemnified parties, but usually excludes any liabilities caused
    by their gross negligence or willful misconduct. With respect to
    certain special facility bonds, the Company agreed to indemnify
    the municipalities for any claims arising out of the issuance
    and sale of the bonds and the use or occupancy of the concourses
    financed by these bonds. Additionally, the Company typically
    indemnifies such parties for any environmental liability that
    arises out of or relates to its use of the leased premises.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The Company is the lessee under many aircraft financing
    agreements (including leveraged lease financings of aircraft
    under pass through trusts) and real estate leases. It is common
    in such transactions for the Company as the lessee to agree to
    indemnify the lessor and other related third parties for the
    manufacture, design, ownership, financing, use, operation and
    maintenance of the aircraft, and for tort liabilities that arise
    out of or relate to the Company&#146;s use or occupancy of the
    leased asset. In some cases, this indemnity extends to related
    liabilities arising from the negligence of the indemnified
    parties, but usually excludes any liabilities caused by their
    gross negligence or willful misconduct.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The Company reviewed its long-term operating leases at a number
    of airports, including leases where the Company is also the
    guarantor of the underlying debt. Such leases are typically with
    municipalities or other governmental entities. The arrangements
    are not required to be consolidated based on the provisions of
    FIN&#160;46(R).
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

<TR>
    <TD width="6%"></TD>
    <TD width="94%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">&#160;&#160;(f)&#160;&#160;</FONT></I></B>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Concentration
    of Credit Risks</FONT></I></B>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The Company invests available cash in money market securities of
    various banks, commercial paper and asset-backed securities of
    various financial institutions, other companies with high credit
    ratings and securities backed by the U.S.&#160;government.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    As of December&#160;31, 2006, most of the Company&#146;s
    receivables related to tickets sold to individual passengers
    through the use of major credit cards or to tickets sold by
    other airlines and used by passengers on US&#160;Airways and AWA
    or its regional airline affiliates. These receivables are
    short-term, mostly being settled within seven days after sale.
    Bad debt losses, which have been minimal in the past, have been
    considered in establishing allowances for doubtful accounts. The
    Company does not believe it is subject to any significant
    concentration of credit risk.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

<TR>
    <TD width="5%"></TD>
    <TD width="95%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">11.&#160;&#160;</FONT></B>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Nonoperating
    Income (Expense)&#160;&#151; Other, Net</FONT></B>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    During 2006, in connection with the conversion of
    $70&#160;million of the 7% Senior Convertible Notes, the Company
    paid an inducement of $17&#160;million to the holders of the
    converted notes, which was recorded in other nonoperating
    expense. In addition, the write-off of $2&#160;million in debt
    issuance costs associated with the notes was recorded in other
    nonoperating expense.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    In 2006 and 2005, the Company recorded $11&#160;million and
    $4&#160;million, respectively, of derivative gains attributable
    to stock options in Sabre and warrants in a number of companies.
    On an ongoing basis, the Company
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <BR>
    118
</DIV><!-- END LOGICAL PAGE -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN LOGICAL PAGE -->

<DIV style="margin-top: 18pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">US&#160;Airways
    Group, Inc.<BR>
    </FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Notes to
    Consolidated Financial
    Statements&#160;&#151;&#160;(Continued)</FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>
<P>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    adjusts its balance sheet to reflect changes in the current fair
    market value of the stock options and warrants according to
    SFAS&#160;133.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    In the first quarter of 2006, the Company recorded
    $6&#160;million in prepayment penalties and wrote off
    $5&#160;million of debt issuance costs related to the
    March&#160;31, 2006 repayment of the AWA Citibank Loan (formerly
    ATSB Loan) and the GECC loan that were paid off with the
    proceeds of the GE Loan.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    In the fourth quarter of 2005, the Company repurchased warrants
    issued to the ATSB. In connection with this repurchase, the
    Company recorded $8&#160;million of nonoperating expense. This
    amount represented the unamortized balance recorded as an other
    asset, which was being amortized over the life of the government
    guaranteed loan as an increase to interest expense.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    In the fourth quarter of 2005, the Company wrote off
    $2&#160;million in issuance costs in connection with the
    conversion of the 7.25% exchangeable notes.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    In connection with the term loan refinancing with GECC, the
    Company wrote off $1&#160;million of debt issuance costs
    associated to the term loan with Mizuho in 2004. This amount was
    recorded in nonoperating expense.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

<TR>
    <TD width="5%"></TD>
    <TD width="95%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">13.&#160;&#160;</FONT></B>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Related
    Party Transactions</FONT></B>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Richard&#160;A. Bartlett, a member of the board of directors of
    US&#160;Airways Group, is a greater than 10% minority owner and
    director of Eastshore. In February 2005, Eastshore entered into
    an agreement with US&#160;Airways Group to provide a
    $125&#160;million financing commitment to provide equity funding
    for a plan of reorganization, in the form of a
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">debtor-in-possession</FONT>
    term loan. Under the terms of US&#160;Airways Group&#146;s plan
    of reorganization, Eastshore received a cash payment in the
    amount of all accrued interest on the loan, and the principal
    amount of $125&#160;million was satisfied by the delivery of
    8,333,333&#160;shares of US&#160;Airways Group common stock,
    representing a price of
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <BR>
    119
</DIV><!-- END LOGICAL PAGE -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN LOGICAL PAGE -->

<DIV style="margin-top: 18pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">US&#160;Airways
    Group, Inc.<BR>
    </FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Notes to
    Consolidated Financial
    Statements&#160;&#151;&#160;(Continued)</FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>
<P>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    $15.00&#160;per share. Mr.&#160;Bartlett is also a greater than
    10% owner of Air Wisconsin. US&#160;Airways and Air Wisconsin
    also entered into a regional jet services agreement under which
    Air Wisconsin may, but is not required to, provide regional jet
    service under a US&#160;Airways Express code share arrangement.
    On April&#160;8, 2005, Air Wisconsin notified US&#160;Airways
    Group of its intention to deploy 70&#160;regional jets, the
    maximum number provided for in the agreement, into the
    US&#160;Airways Express network. The amount paid to Air
    Wisconsin in 2006 was approximately $336&#160;million.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Robert&#160;A. Milton, a member of the board of directors of
    US&#160;Airways Group until April&#160;19, 2006, is the
    Chairman, President and Chief Executive Officer of ACE. ACE
    purchased 5,000,000&#160;shares of US&#160;Airways Group common
    stock at a purchase price of $15.00&#160;per share, for a total
    investment of $75&#160;million. ACE or its subsidiaries entered
    into commercial agreements with US&#160;Airways Group and
    America West Holdings for various services including maintenance
    and airport handling. The amount paid in 2005 for these
    commercial agreements was approximately $2&#160;million.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Edward&#160;L. Shapiro, a member of the board of directors of
    US&#160;Airways Group, is a Vice President and partner of PAR
    Capital Management, the general partner of PAR. PAR received
    10,768,485&#160;shares of US&#160;Airways Group common stock,
    including shares received pursuant to Participation Agreements
    with America West Holdings, for a total investment of
    $160&#160;million.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Richard&#160;P. Schifter, a member of the board of directors of
    US&#160;Airways Group until November&#160;15, 2006, is a partner
    of Texas Pacific Group, which was a controlling stockholder of
    America West Holdings prior to the completion of the merger. An
    affiliate of Texas Pacific Group received $6.4&#160;million as
    an advisory fee for providing financial advisory services in
    2005, in connection with the merger and in contribution for and
    reimbursement for certain expenses incurred by Texas Pacific
    Group and its affiliates in connection with the merger.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">14.&#160;&#160;</FONT></B>

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Merger
    Accounting and Pro Forma Information</FONT></B>
</TD>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

<TR>
    <TD width="7%"></TD>
    <TD width="93%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">&#160;&#160;(a)&#160;&#160;</FONT></I></B>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Purchase
    Price Allocation</FONT></I></B>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The value of the merger consideration was determined based upon
    America West Holdings&#146; traded market price per share due to
    the fact that US&#160;Airways Group was operating under
    bankruptcy protection prior to the merger. The outstanding
    shares in America West Holdings at September&#160;27, 2005 were
    valued at $4.82&#160;per share, resulting in an aggregate value
    assigned to the shares of $175&#160;million. The $4.82&#160;per
    share value was based on the
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">five-day</FONT>
    average share price of America West Holdings, with May&#160;19,
    2005, the merger announcement date, as the midpoint. The
    outstanding shares of America West Holdings Class&#160;A and
    Class&#160;B common stock were converted into shares of
    US&#160;Airways Group common stock at a conversion rate of
    0.5362 and 0.4125, respectively. Certain unsecured creditors of
    US&#160;Airways Group have been or will be issued an aggregate
    of approximately 8.2&#160;million shares of US&#160;Airways
    Group common stock in settlement of their claims, including
    stock issued to the PBGC and ALPA. The fair value of that common
    stock valued at an equivalent price based on the $4.82 value of
    the America West Holdings stock is $96&#160;million. America
    West Holdings incurred $21&#160;million of direct acquisition
    costs in connection with the merger. The following table
    summarizes the components of purchase price (in millions):
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    In connection with US&#160;Airways Group&#146;s emergence from
    bankruptcy, significant prepetition liabilities were discharged.
    The surviving liabilities and the assets acquired in the merger
    are shown at estimated fair value. The Company used an outside
    appraisal firm to assist in determining the fair value of
    long-lived tangible and identifiable intangible assets.
    Significant assets and liabilities adjusted to fair market value
    include expendable spare parts and supplies, property and
    equipment, airport take-off and landing slots, aircraft leases,
    deferred revenue and continuing debt obligations. In connection
    with the merger, primarily due to the relocation of the
    corporate headquarters from Arlington, Virginia to Tempe,
    Arizona, US&#160;Airways accrued in purchase accounting
    $24&#160;million of severance and benefits related to planned
    reductions in force for its non-union employees. The Company
    expects to incur additional severance and benefits for
    reductions in force related to the merger; however, due to
    requirements for continued service during the integration
    period, these severance and benefits will not be an adjustment
    to the purchase price allocation but will be expensed in future
    periods. See Note&#160;5 for discussion of amounts expensed for
    severance and benefits in the fourth quarter of 2005 and 2006.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    In accordance with SFAS&#160;141, the allocation of equity
    values is subject to adjustment for up to one year after the
    date of acquisition when additional information on asset and
    liability valuations becomes available.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    previously recorded fair values are as follows (in millions):
</DIV>

    information became available on assets and liabilities that
    existed as of the acquisition date. Significant adjustments

<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN LOGICAL PAGE -->

<DIV style="margin-top: 18pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">US&#160;Airways
    Group, Inc.<BR>
    </FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Notes to
    Consolidated Financial
    Statements&#160;&#151;&#160;(Continued)</FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>
<P>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    pre-merger NOL generated by US&#160;Airways prior to the merger,
    which in accordance with SFAS&#160;No.&#160;109, the associated
    decrease in the valuation allowance reduced goodwill; an
    adjustment to accounts receivable to reflect credits due from
    Republic related to pre-merger aircraft lease assumptions;
    adjustments to materials and supplies for the refinement of fair
    market value information available at the time of the
    acquisition; adjustments to other assets for the application of
    pre-merger airport operating expense and rent credits and a fair
    market value adjustment to an investment; and adjustments to
    other accrued expenses to refine estimates for remaining pending
    bankruptcy claim matters.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

<TR>
    <TD width="7%"></TD>
    <TD width="93%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">&#160;&#160;(b)&#160;&#160;</FONT></I></B>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Pro
    Forma Information</FONT></I></B>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The following information is presented assuming the merger and
    the conversion of America West Holdings&#146; Class&#160;A and
    Class&#160;B common stock had been completed as of
    January&#160;1, 2004. The pro forma consolidated results of
    operations include purchase accounting adjustments, such as fair
    market value adjustments of the assets and liabilities of
    US&#160;Airways Group, adjustments to reflect the disposition of
    prepetition liabilities upon US&#160;Airways Group&#146;s
    emergence from bankruptcy, and adjustments to conform certain
    accounting policies of US&#160;Airways Group and America West
    Holdings, together with related income tax effects. Certain
    other transactions critical to US&#160;Airways Group&#146;s
    emergence from bankruptcy and the completion of the merger that
    became effective either before, at or immediately following the
    merger have also been reflected in the pro forma financial
    information. These transactions include the new equity
    investments, the comprehensive agreements with GECC, the
    comprehensive agreement with Airbus, the restructuring of the
    ATSB loans, and the restructuring of the credit card partner and
    credit card processing agreements. The unaudited pro forma
    information presented below is not necessarily indicative of the
    results of operations that would have occurred had the purchase
    been made at the beginning of the periods presented or of future
    results of the combined operations (in millions, except share
    and per share amounts).
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

<TR>
    <TD width="5%"></TD>
    <TD width="95%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">15.&#160;&#160;</FONT></B>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Operating
    segments and related disclosures</FONT></B>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    US&#160;Airways Group is managed as a single business unit that
    provides air transportation for passengers and cargo. This
    allows it to benefit from an integrated revenue pricing and
    route network that includes US&#160;Airways, AWA, Piedmont, PSA
    and third-party carriers that fly under capacity purchase
    agreements as part of the Company&#146;s Express operations. The
    flight equipment of all these carriers is combined to form one
    fleet that is deployed through a single route scheduling system.
    When making resource allocation decisions, the chief operating
    decision maker evaluates flight profitability data, which
    considers aircraft type and route economics, but gives no weight
    to the financial impact of the resource allocation decision on
    an individual carrier basis. The objective in making resource
    allocation decisions is to maximize consolidated financial
    results, not the individual results of US&#160;Airways, AWA,
    Piedmont and PSA.
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <BR>
    122
</DIV><!-- END LOGICAL PAGE -->

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The Company attributes operating revenues by geographic region
    based upon the origin and destination of each flight segment.
    The Company&#146;s tangible assets consist primarily of flight
    equipment, which are mobile across geographic markets and,
    therefore, have not been allocated.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

<TR>
    <TD width="5%"></TD>
    <TD width="95%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">16.&#160;&#160;</FONT></B>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Stockholders&#146;
    Equity</FONT></B>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

<TR>
    <TD width="7%"></TD>
    <TD width="93%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">&#160;&#160;(a)&#160;&#160;</FONT></I></B>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Common
    Stock</FONT></I></B>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Holders of common stock are entitled to one vote per share on
    all matters submitted to a vote of common shareholders, except
    that voting rights of
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">non-U.S.&#160;citizens</FONT>
    are limited to the extent that the shares of common stock held
    by such
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">non-U.S.&#160;persons</FONT>
    would otherwise be entitled to more than 24.9% of the aggregate
    votes of all outstanding equity securities of US&#160;Airways
    Group. Holders of common stock have no right to cumulate their
    votes. Holders of common stock participate equally as to any
    dividends or distributions on the common stock.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    On September&#160;30, 2005, US&#160;Airways Group completed a
    public offering of common stock in which it issued
    9,775,000&#160;shares of its common stock at a price of
    $19.30&#160;per share. The Company received net proceeds of
    $180&#160;million from the offering.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

<TR>
    <TD width="7%"></TD>
    <TD width="93%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">&#160;&#160;(b)&#160;&#160;</FONT></I></B>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Warrants</FONT></I></B>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    As compensation for various elements of AWA&#146;s financial
    restructuring completed in January 2002, America West Holdings
    issued a warrant to purchase 18.8&#160;million shares of its
    Class&#160;B common stock to the ATSB and additional warrants to
    purchase 3.8&#160;million shares of its Class&#160;B common
    stock to other loan participants, in each case at an exercise
    price of $3&#160;per share and a term of ten years. For
    accounting purposes, the warrants were valued at
    $35.4&#160;million, or $1.57&#160;per share, using the
    Black-Scholes pricing model with the following assumptions:
    expected dividend yield of 0.0%, risk-free interest rate of
    4.8%, volatility of 44.9% and an expected life of ten years. The
    warrants were recorded by AWA as a non-cash capital contribution
    in the accompanying consolidated statements of
    stockholders&#146; equity and comprehensive income and
    classified as other assets, net in the accompanying consolidated
    balance sheets. The warrants were amortized over the life of the
    AWA ATSB Loan as an increase to interest expense. In the first
    quarter of 2004, approximately 220,000 warrants were exercised
    at $3&#160;per share. In the third quarter of 2003,
    approximately 2.6&#160;million warrants were exercised at
    $3&#160;per share. These warrant exercises were cashless
    transactions resulting in the issuance of approximately
    1.6&#160;million shares of America West Holdings&#146;
    Class&#160;B common stock.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    In the fourth quarter of 2005, US&#160;Airways Group announced
    an agreement to repurchase all of the replacement warrants
    issued to the ATSB in connection with the merger with America
    West Holdings. US&#160;Airways Group repurchased approximately
    7.7&#160;million warrants to purchase shares of common stock
    that had an exercise price of $7.27&#160;per share. The total
    purchase price for the warrants was $116&#160;million, which
    approximated their fair value at the purchase date. In
    connection with this repurchase, AWA recorded $8&#160;million of
    nonoperating expense. This amount represented the unamortized
    balance recorded in other assets, which was being amortized over
    the life of the AWA ATSB Loan as an increase to interest expense.
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <BR>
    123
</DIV><!-- END LOGICAL PAGE -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN LOGICAL PAGE -->

<DIV style="margin-top: 18pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">US&#160;Airways
    Group, Inc.<BR>
    </FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Notes to
    Consolidated Financial
    Statements&#160;&#151;&#160;(Continued)</FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>
<P>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    In the second quarter of 2006, US&#160;Airways Group received
    $2.8&#160;million of proceeds related to the issuance of
    386,925&#160;shares of common stock that were issued pursuant to
    a warrant exercise. As of December&#160;31, 2006, there were no
    warrants outstanding.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

<TR>
    <TD width="5%"></TD>
    <TD width="95%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">17.&#160;&#160;</FONT></B>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Stock-based
    compensation</FONT></B>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Prior to January&#160;1, 2006, the Company accounted for
    stock-based compensation plans in accordance with Accounting
    Principles Board Opinion No.&#160;25, &#147;Accounting for Stock
    Issued to Employees&#148; (&#147;APB&#160;25&#148;) and related
    interpretations. Effective January&#160;1, 2006, the Company
    adopted SFAS&#160;No.&#160;123R, &#147;Share-Based Payment&#148;
    (&#147;SFAS&#160;123R&#148;), using the modified prospective
    transition method. Under the modified prospective transition
    method, compensation cost is recognized in the financial
    statements beginning with the effective date based on the
    requirements of SFAS&#160;123R for all share-based payments
    granted after that date, and based on the requirements of
    SFAS&#160;No.&#160;123, &#147;Accounting for Stock Based
    Compensation&#148; (&#147;SFAS&#160;123&#148;) for all unvested
    awards granted prior to the effective date of SFAS&#160;123R.
    Results for prior periods are not restated using the modified
    prospective transition method.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Substantially all of America West Holdings and AWA employee
    stock options outstanding at the time of the merger were fully
    vested in accordance with the change of control provisions of
    America West Holdings&#146; stock option plans and were
    converted into options of US&#160;Airways Group. Existing stock
    options of US&#160;Airways Group outstanding prior to the merger
    on September&#160;27, 2005 were cancelled as part of the plan of
    reorganization. Accordingly, as of January&#160;1, 2006, only
    unvested stock options, stock appreciation rights and restricted
    stock units granted subsequent to and in connection with the
    merger are subject to the transition provisions of
    SFAS&#160;123R. As part of the plan of reorganization, the
    Bankruptcy Court approved a new equity incentive plan, referred
    to as the 2005 Incentive Equity Plan (the &#147;2005 Incentive
    Plan&#148;). The 2005 Incentive Plan provides for the grant of
    incentive stock options, nonstatutory stock options, stock
    appreciation rights, stock purchase awards, stock bonus awards,
    stock unit awards, and other forms of equity compensation,
    collectively referred to as stock awards, as well as
    performance-based cash awards. Incentive stock options granted
    under the 2005 Incentive Plan are intended to qualify as
    &#147;incentive stock options&#148; within the meaning of
    Section&#160;422 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as
    amended. Nonstatutory stock options granted under the 2005
    Incentive Plan are not intended to qualify as incentive stock
    options under the Internal Revenue Code.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    A maximum of 12.5% of the fully-diluted shares (as of the
    completion of the merger) of US&#160;Airways Group common stock
    is available for issuance under the 2005 Incentive Plan,
    totaling 10,969,191&#160;shares. Any or all of these shares may
    be granted pursuant to incentive stock options. Shares of
    US&#160;Airways Group common stock issued under the 2005
    Incentive Plan may be unissued shares or reacquired shares,
    purchased on the open market or otherwise. At December&#160;31,
    2006, approximately 5.5&#160;million shares are available for
    grant under the 2005 Equity Incentive Plan.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The number of shares of US&#160;Airways Group common stock
    available for issuance under the 2005 Incentive Plan will be
    reduced by (i)&#160;one share for each share of stock issued
    pursuant to a stock option or a stock appreciation right, and
    (ii)&#160;three shares for each share of stock issued pursuant
    to a stock purchase award, stock bonus award, stock unit award,
    and other full-value types of stock awards. Stock awards that
    are terminated, forfeited or repurchased will result in an
    increase in the share reserve of the 2005 Incentive Plan
    corresponding to the reduction originally made in respect of the
    award.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    If a stock award granted under the 2005 Incentive Plan or
    AWA&#146;s previous incentive plan (the &#147;2002 Incentive
    Plan&#148;) expires or otherwise terminates without being
    exercised in full, or if any shares of US&#160;Airways Group
    common stock issued pursuant to a stock award under the 2005
    Incentive Plan are forfeited to or repurchased by
    US&#160;Airways Group, including, but not limited to, any
    repurchase or forfeiture caused by the failure to meet a
    contingency or condition required for the vesting of such
    shares, then the shares of US&#160;Airways Group common stock
    not issued under that stock award, or forfeited to or
    repurchased by US&#160;Airways Group, will revert to and
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <BR>
    124
</DIV><!-- END LOGICAL PAGE -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN LOGICAL PAGE -->

<DIV style="margin-top: 18pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">US&#160;Airways
    Group, Inc.<BR>
    </FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Notes to
    Consolidated Financial
    Statements&#160;&#151;&#160;(Continued)</FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>
<P>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    again become available for issuance under the 2005 Incentive
    Plan. If any shares subject to a stock award are not delivered
    to a participant because those shares are withheld for the
    payment of taxes or the stock award is exercised through a
    reduction of shares subject to the stock award (<I>i.e</I>.,
    &#147;net exercised&#148;), the number of shares that are not
    delivered will remain available for issuance under the 2005
    Incentive Plan. If the exercise price of any stock award is
    satisfied by tendering shares of US&#160;Airways Group common
    stock held by the participant, then the number of shares so
    tendered (whether by actual tender or by attestation of
    ownership) will remain available for issuance under the 2005
    Incentive Plan. Shares of US&#160;Airways Group common stock
    subject to stock awards issued in substitution for previously
    outstanding awards assumed in connection with a merger,
    consolidation or similar transaction will not reduce the number
    of shares available for issuance under the 2005 Incentive Plan.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The Company&#146;s net income for the year ended
    December&#160;31, 2006 includes $35&#160;million of compensation
    costs related to share-based payments. Compensation expense of
    $4&#160;million, calculated using the provisions of APB&#160;25,
    was recorded for stock appreciation rights and restricted stock
    units granted to employees of US&#160;Airways Group in the
    fourth quarter of 2005. Upon adoption of SFAS&#160;123R, the
    Company recorded a cumulative benefit from the accounting change
    of $1&#160;million, which reflects the impact of estimating
    future forfeitures for previously recognized compensation
    expense. Pursuant to APB&#160;25, stock compensation expense was
    not reduced for estimated future forfeitures, but instead was
    reversed upon actual forfeiture. No income tax effect related to
    share-based payments or cumulative effect has been recorded as
    the effects have been immediately offset by the recording of a
    valuation allowance through the same financial statement caption.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <I>Restricted Stock Unit Awards</I>&#160;&#151; As of
    December&#160;31, 2006, the Company has outstanding restricted
    stock unit awards (&#147;RSUs&#148;) with service conditions
    (vesting periods) and RSUs with service and performance
    conditions (vesting periods and obtaining a combined operating
    certificate for AWA and US&#160;Airways). SFAS&#160;123R
    requires that the grant-date fair value of RSUs be equal to the
    market price of the share on the date of grant if vesting is
    based on a service or a performance condition. The grant-date
    fair value of RSU awards that are subject to both a service and
    a performance condition are being expensed over the vesting
    period, as the performance condition is considered probable and
    the vesting periods of the awards are longer than the period
    allowed to meet the performance condition. Vesting periods for
    RSU awards range from two to four years. RSUs are classified as
    equity awards.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    There were no RSUs granted during 2004. Restricted stock unit
    award activity for the years ending December&#160;31, 2006 and
    2005 is as follows (shares in thousands):
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE border="0" width="100%" align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    As of December&#160;31, 2006, there was $12&#160;million of
    total unrecognized compensation costs related to RSUs. These
    costs are expected to be recognized over a weighted average
    period of 1.1&#160;years. The total fair value of restricted
    stock awards vested during 2006 was $3&#160;million. No
    restricted stock vested during 2005 or 2004.
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <BR>
    125

<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN LOGICAL PAGE -->

<DIV style="margin-top: 18pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">US&#160;Airways
    Group, Inc.<BR>
    </FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Notes to
    Consolidated Financial
    Statements&#160;&#151;&#160;(Continued)</FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>
<P>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <I>Stock Options and Stock Appreciation Rights</I>&#160;&#151;
    Stock options and stock appreciation rights (&#147;SARs&#148;)
    are granted with an exercise price equal to the common
    stock&#146;s fair market value at the date of each grant,
    generally become exercisable over a three to four-year period
    and expire if unexercised at the end of ten years. Stock options
    and SARs are classified as equity awards. The exercise of SARs
    will be settled with the issuance of shares of the
    Company&#146;s common stock.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Stock option and SARs activity for the year ending
    December&#160;31, 2006 is as follows (stock options and SARs in
    thousands):
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE border="0" width="100%" align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The fair value of stock options and SARs is determined at the
    grant date using a Black-Scholes option pricing model, which
    requires several assumptions. The risk-free interest rate is
    based on the U.S.&#160;Treasury yield curve in effect for the
    expected term of the stock option or SAR at the time of grant.
    The dividend yield is assumed to be zero since the Company does
    not pay dividends and has no current plans to do so in the
    future. The volatility is based on the historical volatility of
    US&#160;Airways Group common stock over a time period equal to
    the expected term of the stock option or SAR. The expected life
    of stock options and SARs is based on the historical experience
    of the Company.
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    127
</DIV><!-- END LOGICAL PAGE -->

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    As of December&#160;31, 2006, there was $24&#160;million of
    total unrecognized compensation costs related to stock options
    and SARs. These costs are expected to be recognized over a
    weighted average period of 1.4&#160;years.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The total intrinsic value of stock options and SARs exercised
    during the years ended December&#160;31, 2006, 2005, and 2004
    was $68&#160;million, $13&#160;million, and $1&#160;million,
    respectively. Cash received from stock option and SAR exercises
    during the year ended December&#160;31, 2006 totaled
    $51&#160;million. The tax benefit realized from stock options
    and SARs exercised during 2006 was $26&#160;million. Tax expense
    of $0.2&#160;million was recognized for exercises with book
    expense exceeding the tax deduction.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <I>Agreements with ALPA</I>&#160;&#151; US&#160;Airways Group
    and US&#160;Airways have a letter of agreement with the ALPA
    that provides that US&#160;Airways&#146; pilots designated by
    ALPA receive stock options to purchase 1.1&#160;million shares
    of the Company&#146;s common stock. At an exercise price equal
    to the average market price for the 20&#160;business days
    preceding the option issuance date. The first tranche of 500,000
    stock options was granted on January&#160;31, 2006 with an
    exercise price of $33.65. The second tranche of 300,000 stock
    options was granted on January&#160;31, 2007 with an exercise
    price of $56.90. The third and final tranche of 300,000 stock
    options will be issued on January&#160;31, 2008. The stock
    options granted to ALPA pilots do not reduce the shares
    available for grant under any equity incentive plan. Any of
    these ALPA stock options that are forfeited or that expire
    without being exercised will not become available for grant
    under any of the Company&#146;s plans.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The per share fair value of the ALPA pilot stock options granted
    on January&#160;31, 2006 was $17.11, calculated using a
    Black-Scholes option pricing model with the following
    assumptions:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE border="0" width="100%" align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <TD width="90%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=01 type=maindata -->

    <TD width="1%" align="right">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=02 type=lead -->
    <TD width="6%" align="right">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=02 type=body -->
    <TD width="1%" align="left">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=02 type=hang1 -->
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom" style="background: #CCEEFF">
<TD align="left" valign="bottom">
<DIV style="text-indent: -10pt; margin-left: 10pt">

    </FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    As of December&#160;31, 2006 there were no unrecognized
    compensation costs related to stock options granted to ALPA
    pilots as the stock options were fully vested on the grant date.
    There were 315,390 stock options exercised as of
    December&#160;31, 2006 pursuant to this agreement. Cash received
    from stock options exercised during the year ended
    December&#160;31, 2006 totaled $12&#160;million. The tax benefit
    realized from stock options exercised during 2006 was
    $2&#160;million. Tax expense of $0.5&#160;million was recognized
    for option exercises with book expense exceeding the tax
    deduction. The total intrinsic value of options exercised during
    2006 was $5&#160;million.
</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <TD width="4%"></TD>

    <TD width="95%"></TD>

    <TD valign="top">
    (a) </TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="bottom">
    Allowance for doubtful receivables additions in the 2005 period
    include $8&#160;million from the opening balance sheet of
    US&#160;Airways at September&#160;27, 2005.</TD>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN LOGICAL PAGE -->
<A name='113'>
<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

<TR>
    <TD width="9%"></TD>
    <TD width="91%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Item&#160;8B.<I>&#160;&#160;</I></FONT></B>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Consolidated
    Financial Statements and Supplementary Data of America West
    Airlines, Inc.</FONT></I></B>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</A>
<DIV style="margin-top: 18pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Report of
    Independent Registered Public Accounting Firm</FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The Board of Directors and Stockholder
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    America West Airlines, Inc.:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    We have audited the accompanying consolidated balance sheets of
    America West Airlines, Inc. and subsidiary as of
    December&#160;31, 2006 and 2005, and the related consolidated
    statements of operations, stockholder&#146;s equity (deficiency)
    and comprehensive income, and cash flows for each of the years
    in the three-year period ended December&#160;31, 2006. These
    consolidated financial statements are the responsibility of the
    Company&#146;s management. Our responsibility is to express an
    opinion on these consolidated financial statements based on our
    audits.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    We conducted our audits in accordance with the standards of the
    Public Company Accounting Oversight Board (United States). Those
    standards require that we plan and perform the audit to obtain
    reasonable assurance about whether the financial statements are
    free of material misstatement. An audit includes examining, on a
    test basis, evidence supporting the amounts and disclosures in
    the financial statements. An audit also includes assessing the
    accounting principles used and significant estimates made by
    management, as well as evaluating the overall financial
    statement presentation. We believe that our audits provide a
    reasonable basis for our opinion.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    In our opinion, the consolidated financial statements referred
    to above present fairly, in all material respects, the financial
    position of America West Airlines, Inc. and subsidiary as of
    December&#160;31, 2006 and 2005, and the results of their
    operations and their cash flows for each of the years in the
    three-year period ended December&#160;31, 2006, in conformity
    with U.S.&#160;generally accepted accounting principles.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    As discussed in Note&#160;4 to the consolidated financial
    statements, the Company adopted the provisions of Statement of
    Financial Accounting Standards (&#147;SFAS&#148;)
    No.&#160;123(R), <I>Share Based Payment</I>, effective
    January&#160;1, 2006. Also, as discussed in Note&#160;2 to the
    consolidated financial statements, the Company changed its
    method of accounting for major scheduled airframe, engine and
    certain component overhaul costs from the deferral method to the
    direct expense method in 2005.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 24pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <DIV style="display:inline; text-align:left;">/s/&#160;&#160;KPMG
    LLP</DIV>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Phoenix, Arizona
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    February&#160;27, 2007
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <BR>
    131
</DIV><!-- END LOGICAL PAGE -->

<DIV style="text-indent: -10pt; margin-left: 10pt">
    <FONT style="font-size: 10pt">Unaudited pro forma net loss
    (assuming change in method of accounting for maintenance costs
    was applied retroactively) (Note&#160;2)
    </FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>

</TD>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">America
    West Airlines, Inc.<BR>
    </FONT></B>

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Consolidated
    Statements of Cash Flows<BR>
    </FONT></B>

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">For the
    Years Ended December&#160;31, 2006, 2005 and 2004</FONT></B>

    <B>2006</B>
